DataElement.preferredName: Exceptional Response Review Panel Case Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Unique identifier for a report of collection of information about a patient who has achieved either a complete disease response, or a partial disease response of at least 6 months duration in a trial or treatment where the overall response rate is less than 10 percent.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Exceptional Response Review Panel Case Identification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An achievement of either a complete disease response, or a partial disease response of at least 6 months duration in a trial or treatment where the overall response rate is less than 10 percent._A person with a responsibility for examining something to make sure that it is adequate, accurate, or correct._Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit._An uncontrolled observational study containing a detailed report of the diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up of an individual patient. Case reports also contain some demographic information about the patient (for example, age, gender, ethnic origin)._The procedure of having an identity established.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An achievement of either a complete disease response, or a partial disease response of at least 6 months duration in a trial or treatment where the overall response rate is less than 10 percent.:A person with a responsibility for examining something to make sure that it is adequate, accurate, or correct.:A detailed report of the diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up of an individual patient. Case reports also contain some demographic information about the patient (for example, age, gender, ethnic origin).

Concepts.definition: An achievement of either a complete disease response, or a partial disease response of at least 6 months duration in a trial or treatment where the overall response rate is less than 10 percent.
A person with a responsibility for examining something to make sure that it is adequate, accurate, or correct.

An uncontrolled observational study containing a detailed report of the diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up of an individual patient. Case reports also contain some demographic information about the patient (for example, age, gender, ethnic origin).

Property.preferredDefinition: Identified; having the identity known or established.

Concepts.definition: The procedure of having an identity established.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: one or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/23/22 jk added "Qualified" RS as part of MCL quarterly content review  5/5/16 tt, updated definition to match NCIt.
